rtomatoes.title: Movie This Week: McFarland USA
rtomatoes.topComment: 78%: Disney's inspirational sports drama formula might be old hat, but McFarland, USA proves it still works -- especially with a talented director and eminently likable star in the mix.

rtomatoes.title: Movie This Week: Wild Tales
rtomatoes.topComment: 93%: Wickedly hilarious and delightfully deranged, Wild Tales is a subversive satire that doubles as a uniformly entertaining anthology film.

rtomatoes.title: Box Office: Fifty Shades of Grey - $85.2M
rtomatoes.topComment: 25%: While creatively better endowed than its print counterpart, Fifty Shades of Grey is a less than satisfying experience on the screen.

rtomatoes.title: Box Office: Kingsman: The Secret Service - $36.2M
rtomatoes.topComment: 74%: Stylish, subversive, and above all fun, Kingsman: The Secret Service finds director Matthew Vaughn sending up the spy genre with gleeful abandon.

rtomatoes.title: Box Office: The SpongeBob Movie: Sponge Out of Water - $31.5M
rtomatoes.topComment: 74%: The SpongeBob Movie: Sponge Out of Water won't win over many viewers who aren't fans of the show, but for the converted, it's another colorful burst of manic fun.

rtomatoes.title: Box Office: American Sniper - $16.4M
rtomatoes.topComment: 73%: Powered by Clint Eastwood's sure-handed direction and a gripping central performance from Bradley Cooper, American Sniper delivers a tense, vivid tribute to its real-life subject.
